page.title: 11BALDWIN'S BRICKWORKS BUNNY
page.content: Bricks have been made in Bunny for hundreds of years. In 1936 a{kiln}was built in the brickyard by{H.J.Baldwin {Ltd.,}and since then they have made a good number of bricks. The clay they use is called{keuper marl}and it is quarried from Bunny Hill. They mix the clay with water to make the substance for bricks, and put it into moulds. The bricks are taken out of the moulds and stacked in the kiln to dry for 9 days. Then they fire the bricks, the oven has to be{980'C}and the bricks stay in for 3 days. Then the kiln is switched off and the bricks are left for 6 days to cool. Baldwins also make cable covers in 5 different sizes and concrete slabs.{Imperial}sizes are made for home and export. The last lot of goods was cable covers which they sold to the{SUDAN.}There are 3 workers in the quarry and 37 in the brickyard.
